p: The first reported DF outbreak in Solomon Islands occurred in Honiara, the capital city of Solomon Islands, in 1982, but it was only confirmed serologically in 1992 [ 11]. A 10-year inter-epidemic cyclic pattern was observed until 2008, when DENV-4 first started to circulate the region [ 12]. A subsequent outbreak in 2013 was more severe, resulting in the first reported deaths [ 13]. This outbreak was unique, as it lasted longer than usual, i.e., previous outbreaks lasted 2â€‰years, but the 2013 outbreak lasted until early 2016. This, in addition to the global expansion and reported occurrence of Zika virus (ZIKV) and chikungunya virus (CHKV) infections in the region [ 14, 15], prompted us to carry out this study.
